title: 2012 June rugby union tests
text:
The 2012 mid-year rugby union tests (also known as the Summer Internationals in the <a href="Northern%20Hemisphere">Northern Hemisphere</a>) refer to the <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> Internationals that were played through June, mostly in the <a href="Southern%20Hemisphere">Southern Hemisphere</a>.
These matches marked the start of a global rugby calendar established by the <a href="International%20Rugby%20Board">International Rugby Board</a> (IRB), which runs until 2019. The calendar includes a return of traditional tours by European teams, in which a team plays multiple Tests against a southern hemisphere side, often with mid-week matches against provincial or regional sides. This year, all three of the teams that competed in the Rugby Championship's predecessor tournament, the <a href="The%20Rugby%20Championship">Tri Nations</a>, hosted European nations in three-Test series. <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Australia</a> hosted <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a>, marking the first three-Test series in Australia by a top European side since the <a href="British%20%26amp%3B%20Irish%20Lions">British & Irish Lions</a>' <a href="2001%20British%20%26amp%3B%20Irish%20Lions%20tour%20to%20Australia">2001 tour</a>. <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">South Africa</a> hosted <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a> for three Tests, the first extended tour of that country by a single nation since New Zealand toured in 1996.
The new calendar also provided expanded Test opportunities for so-called "Tier 2" nations. As part of this IRB initiative, another tradition returned—tours of the Pacific Islands by major nations. <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> became the first Tier 1 nation to play a Test in the Pacific Islands since 2006, visiting <a href="Fiji%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Fiji</a> and <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Samoa</a>. Also, Italy toured the Americas, claiming wins over <a href="Canada%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Canada</a> and the <a href="United%20States%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">United States</a> and a loss to <a href="Argentina%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Argentina</a>.
